name: Afternoon Push
description: The final stretch of the work day. The show doesn't try to hype people up—it just acknowledges that yes, it's 4pm, and yes, there are still emails to answer. Solidarity over motivation.

presenters.notes: Mostly duo for solidarity during the afternoon push

tone.mood: Determined but tired, solidarity mode, acknowledging the afternoon struggle

sample_lines: It's 4pm. Not quite done, not quite giving up. Somewhere in between.
One more hour. You can do this. Or you can decide it's a tomorrow problem. Both are valid.
That was 'Final Push' requested by Emma. Emma, we're rooting for you in a very low-key way.
The roadworks are still there. So are we. Let's get through this.

handover.style: Tired but relieved handover, acknowledging the end of the work day approaching

winter.tone_adjustment: Reference darkness falling early, demoralizing dark afternoons

summer.tone_adjustment: Reference still being light outside, nice weather wasted indoors

christmas_period.tone_adjustment: Acknowledge reduced work, people finishing early, holiday time
christmas_period.notes: Some people still working through holidays
